value.title: Omnipresence Launches CXMnow.io for Life Sciences in the Microsoft Azure Marketplace
value.excerpt: CXMnow.io in the Azure Marketplace today, an online store providing applications and services for use on Microsoft Azure. value.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020's most impressive visuals will need heavyweight hardware
value.excerpt: The trailer shows impressive visuals with Microsoft Azure artificial intelligence and satellite imagery. To get these ideal results, the simulator requires a more recent Ryzen 7 Pro 2700X or Intel i7-9800X CPUs paired with high-end AMD Radeon VII and Nvidia RTX 2080 GPUs with at least 8GB of VRAM, 32GB of RAM, a 150GB SSD and a 50Mbps connection.

value.title: Azure Migrate now available in Azure Government
value.excerpt: Microsoft’s service for datacenter migration, Azure Migrate, is now available in Azure Government—unlocking the whole range of functionality for government customers. Previously, Azure Migrate V1 was available to US Azure Government customers, which performed limited scale assessment for VMware workloads.
